title: 35-year-old Syracuse man dies after being shot on Tioga Street, police say
content:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- A 35-year-old man has died after being shot Sunday night, according to Syracuse police.
Francisco Tejeda, of Syracuse, sustained multiple gunshot wounds and was transported to Upstate University Hospital where he later died from his injuries, police said.
Syracuse police responded to a shooting complaint on the 300 block of Tioga Street at about 7:40 p.m. There were reports of several shots being fired, and a large crowd in the area.
A 10-year-old boy was also shot. He sustained a gunshot wound to his right ankle. He was transported to Upstate University Hospital where he is currently in stable condition, police said.
Syracuse police say it is early in the investigation. The suspect in this incident possibly left the area in a black four-door sedan, heading westbound on Otisco Street towards South Geddes Street. There is no further suspect description at this time.
Anyone with information can call the Syracuse Police Department at 442-5222. All calls will be kept confidential. Anonymous tips may also be submitted using the "SPD Tips" App.
